metadata.titel_preek: The Threat of Life: Permitting Its Intrusion

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God’s power for life (resurrection) intrudes into a world of deathly control, shattering human categories and inviting a transition from fear to praise.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically as the 'God of the living' and the 'Power of Life')
tekstueel_bewijs: God will do a new thing.
God’s power for life... moves into all our arrangements, shatters all our categories.
God gives new life which shatters all our ways of control.
The power of the resurrection is so massive, so overwhelming, so utterly new.
God wills life. God has power for life.
It is true because of the character and purpose and faithfulness of God.
The God of life wills life for us.
The whole world is engaged in celebrative acknowledgment.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to move from being an Opponent (Sadducee) to a Receiver (David).

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus came into their midst as a threat of newness.
He speaks about God whom he knows so well and whom we confess he embodies.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; Jesus is the embodiment/agent of that Subjectivity.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that shatters internal resistance.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Sadducees / Human Systems of Control / Deathliness
tekstueel_bewijs: The Sadducees... traffic in power... they do not want change.
All our political, moral, theological tinkering around the edges.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a 'vicious cycle of death' and 'deathly arrangements' that require a divine shattering.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of praise and relinquishment of control (Doxology).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (modeled by David)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Praise is the result of being overwhelmed by the Primary Program (God's life-giving act).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Character → New Life → The World

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will work life among us.
God there refers back to Abraham.
God has not yet quit and God will have God’s way.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We become aware... we are placed in crisis.
They realistically live in this world.

voorbeelden: Praise does not... terminate the requirement of taking care of widows.
They think their old rules will cover all eventualities.
The power of the resurrection is the breaking of the vicious cycles of death.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Power-event.' It focuses on God's ability (Pouvoir) to overcome the human inability to escape death.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Deathly control of Sadducees) through ~S1 (the inadequacy of religious rules) to S1 (God's massive new life) and finally ~S2 (Davidic praise).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'character of God' which makes S1 inevitable despite S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'insanity' and 'vicious cycles'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; the human role is receptive and responsive (praise) rather than causative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: David is an amazing model of faith for us.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God gives new life which shatters all our ways of control.
The cold despair of our deathliness will be overcome.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is used as a model, but specifically as a model of *relinquishing* control to God, not as a hero of moral effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: David's praise is a reaction to God's sovereignty.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the 'shattering' of the ego's need to control.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: God acts, man receives and thanks.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Gospel narrative to the Davidic response is logically and theologically seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Bible games' and 'massive newness'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He is the power of life in the midst of a world bent on death.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'deathliness' and 'insanity' that humans cannot manage or fix.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program, avoiding the trap of making the hearer the hero of their own transformation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God gives life) correctly precedes Ethics (We address the age with care).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching where the 'engine' of the sermon is fueled by divine agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on Brueggemann's use of 'sniffing' and 'smelling' metaphors, Greimas reveals that these metaphors serve to identify the 'Sender' (Jesus) as a sensory threat to the 'Opponent's' (Sadducees) system.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Levirate law; Greimas shows that the law is merely a 'Helper' or 'Opponent' tool in the larger conflict of Power (Resurrection vs. Death).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'Sadducees' are not just historical figures but represent the 'Opponent' actant within the hearer's own psyche—the part that fears God's intrusion.

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the Davidic text as a 'Secondary Program' that provides the modal competence of 'Vouloir' (willingness to praise) after the Primary Program has provided 'Pouvoir' (the power of life).
